page.title: 04 COBB'S CARAVAN PARK
page.content:
The camp opened in 1928. Reginald John Cobb opened the camp. He owned the camp for 39 years. Mr Cobb died in 1967. Reginald had one son called Jim. Jim was the next owner. In 1940 four bombs were dropped on the camp. The bombs did not kill anyone, only four rabbits. Cobb's Caravan Park has a club and a shop. The shop opened in 1936. The club opened in 1978. The club is a social club. In the club there is a pool table, a dart board, a bar and a television. The shop sells gifts, clothes and food. There are 65 caravans and 19 chalets. There are four families living on the camp all year. Over 1,000 people come each year for holidays.
By Angilika Kinley.
